item.description:
Mission of our group: Three fold
1. Enjoy the passion, energized feeling, and love of dancing. Have a lot of fun!
2. Develop new valued friendships with both men and women.
3. Develop a fulfilling long-term monogamous relationship.

Values:
1. We believe that a long-term, fulfilling relationship is built on some fundamental values: Integrity, Honesty, Respect, Loyalty, Reliability, and Non-judgment in our communication with each other. We value each other’s opinion. We listen!
2. We strive to be positive, optimistic, kind, giving professionals. How? We don’t criticize, condemn or complain.
3. We value diversity in religions, nationalities, and ethnic backgrounds. We cooperate as a team to be successful by inviting other professional people we know.
4. We demonstrate this respectful/ nonjudgmental mindset in two ways:
A. By saying Yes to someone who asks us to dance. (once)
B. By offering positive solutions or alternatives if you disagree with something. (Please don’t criticize, condemn or complain) We welcome suggestions to improve the experience.

If someone is alone go up to them and say hi! Please be Friendly, Positive, and optimistic to everyone.

Please invite other friends, particularly men. Our personal goal is to have an equal amount of men and women. We did last dance.

The synergistic efforts of everyone will make it truly a memorable dance party.

***The cost is $12.00 plus wine or food assignment listed below.
Of course if you are unable to bring anything, then your entry fee will be $30.00.

Organizer/Host - Richard Tosti

Format:
Location is in a warm, loving and relaxing environment.
"Dress code - "business casual" – NO JEANS OR SNEAKERS
7:30pm - 11:30pm
Saturday, Jan. 3, 2009
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA
Maximum attendees 160
Dancing will be available - DJ

Buffet which will start at 8:00
Open Bar - wine/beer that you are assigned to bring

If your last name begins with the following letter please bring the following.

A-J Italian entrée –or you're favorite dish/ only suggestions - finger sandwiches/ meatballs / sausage, peppers & onions / ziti with sauce / chicken wings/ baked stuffed shells / pizza/ linguini with sauce and of course cheese/lasagna,/ chicken with broccoli & ziti / vegetable lasagna / calzones / / baked macaroni and cheese.

K-T wine or beer

U-V 2 bottles soda (1 diet & 1 regular) and 2 gallons of water

W-Z dessert - only suggestions – Italian cookies, pie, cake, Brownie Sunday with sauce and whipped cream,

160 guests only

Location and Directions
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

128 North
Exit 32B Middlesex Turnpike (Burlington/Arlington)
At the end of the ramp turn right onto Middlesex Turnpike - on the left is Barnes/Noble
After the Burlington Mall turn right on to Burlington Mall Rd. - on left is Longs Jewelers
Take left second light after you pass Kohl’s on your left which is Lexington Street
Temple Shalom Emeth is on your left at16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA -end of street
1.4 miles on left- see all the cars

There are two parking lots on the right side of building. Enter through the side entrance at the end of the building. Third parking lot is two houses up at Church - we have permission. Fourth parking lot is across the street - McGinnis Ave., - Mt Hope Church.

You know the time, the location and what you should bring so let’s have fun!
See you on Saturday, January 3, at 7:30pm----

Party begins at 7:30pm
Food is served at 8:00pm- please be here with your contribution.
Dessert and coffee served at 9:00pm

No shellfish or pork products.

See you soon,

The best is yet to be!
Richard Tosti
item.name: Private Singles Party 40-65
